WMDA P-Group Definitions

Source: R/data.R
deepMatchR_wmda_pgroups.Rd

A lookup table containing HLA P-group definitions from WMDA nomenclature. P-groups are sets of alleles with identical protein sequences in the antigen recognition site. Used internally by toSerology to resolve P-group notation.

Usage

data(deepMatchR_wmda_pgroups)

Format

A data.table with the following columns:

locus

`character`. HLA locus (e.g., `"A"`, `"B"`, `"DRB1"`).

p_group

`character`. P-group designation (e.g., `"01:01P"`).

reference_2f

`character`. Reference two-field allele for the P-group.

Source

WMDA nomenclature files from IMGT/HLA GitHub repository (https://github.com/ANHIG/IMGTHLA/tree/Latest/wmda).

Details

P-group notation (e.g., `"A*01:01P"`) indicates that multiple alleles share the same protein sequence in the antigen recognition domain. This table maps P-groups to their representative reference alleles for serology lookup.

See also

toSerology, deepMatchR_wmda_serology
